intro: Erucastrum austroafricanum, commonly known as the African cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are edible and have a peppery flavor, similar to that of mustard greens. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in moist, open habitats.
